document.docAuthor: Cipola, Nikolas Gioia, Morais, José Wellington De & Bellini, Bruno Cavalcante
document.docTitle: Trogolaphysa nigrolineata Cipola & Morais & Bellini 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Survey of Trogolaphysa Mills (Collembola, Paronellidae) of the Brazilian Amazon including five new species and the description of the dorsal chaetotaxy of the first instar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Survey of Trogolaphysa Mills (Collembola, Paronellidae) of the Brazilian Amazon including five new species and the description of the dorsal chaetotaxy of the first instar

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Corresponding Author: nikolasgc @ gmail. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 7594 - 9574

Programa de Pós-graduação em Sistemática e Evolução, Centro de Biociências, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte. Rodovia BR 101, Lagoa Nova, Campus Universitário, 59072 - 970 Natal, RN, Brazil.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Th II to Abd III laterally with one black longitudinal, Abd IV with s transversal strip, femur III distally and tibiotarsus I–III medially pigmented ( Fig.13 ); Ant IV weakly annulated ( Fig. 14A ); Ant III with 1 dorsal and 1 ventral mac plus 9 dorsal and 5 ventral elongated sens ( Fig. 14C ); Ant II with 5 dorsal mac and 6 ventral mac plus 4 dorsal elongated sens ( Fig. 14C ); Ant I with 5 dorsal mac ( Fig. 14C ); head mac A0 , A2 , M2 , M4 , S3 , S5 and Pa5 present ( Fig. 14E ); prelabral chaetae smooth; labral papillae absent ( Fig. 14D ); labial papilla E with l.p. conical and not reaching the base of a.a. ( Fig. 15A ); basolateral and basomedian labial fields with chaetae M1 and L2 ciliate, m2 , e and l1 smooth, r reduced ( Fig. 15C ); postlabial X chaeta present ( Fig. 15D ); Th II–Abd IV with 2+3, 0 | 0, 1+1, 1+6 and 5+18 mac, respectively; Abd IV with 17 sens ( Fig. 16 ); femur I–II with 6 inner mac and femur III with an inner row of 5 mac apically rounded ( Figs 17E–F ); unguis I–III b.t. slightly larger than m.t. , b.t. and m.t. far apart, a.t. present or absent; unguiculus I–III lamellae acuminate, except pe with 1 minute proximal tooth ( Figs 17H–I ); mucro with 4 teeth ( Fig. 18F ).

Description. Total length (head + trunk) of the specimens 3.03–2.62 (n=4), holotype 3.03 mm . Specimens pale white to yellowish with dark pigments on Ant III–IV, distal two thirds of Ant I–II, a longitudinal strip on lateral Th II to Abd III, lateral sclerite of Abd III with a spot that extends to anterior spots of Abd IV, Abd IV with two lateral spots (anterior and posterior), femur III distally and tibiotarsus I–III medially dark pigmented; eyepatches black ( Fig. 13 ). Scales present on Ant I to proximal two thirds of Ant III.

Head. Antennae subequal or slightly longer than the trunk length ( Fig. 13 ); ratio antennae: trunk = 1: 0.98–1.13 (n=4), holotype 1: 0.98; antennal segments ratio as I: II: III: IV = 1: 1.37–1.58: 1.66: 2.73–2.94, holotype 1: 1.58: 1.66: 2.81.Ant IV weakly annulated on its distal two thirds, with at least 4 sens types, 3 apical finger-shaped, 2 apical and 2 subapical conical, and numerous pointed and weakly pointed sens, no apical bulb or subapical organite ( Fig. 14A ). Ant III organ with 2 elongated finger-shaped sens, 3 small sens, 1 elongated thin sens and ciliated chaetae ( Fig. 14B ); dorsally with 1 mac and 9 elongated thin sens; ventrally with 1 mac and 5 elongated thin sens ( Fig. 14C ). Ant II dorsally with 5 mac and 4 elongated thin sens distally; ventrally with 6 mac, without elongated thin sens ( Fig. 14C ). Ant I dorsally with 5 median mac (3 inner and 2 outer) and 3 smooth mic atbase; ventrally with 2 mac ( Fig. 14C ). Prelabral chaetae smooth; labral a1 chaeta thicker, m0–1 slightly longer, p0–2 clearly longer than a chaetae; labral papillae absent ( Fig. 14D ). Eyes A–F subequal, eyes G and H much smaller; 7 ‘IO’ chaetae (2 of unclear homologies); head dorsal macrochaetotaxy with 15–16 ‘An’ ( An1a–3p ), 2 ‘A’ ( A0 , A2 ), 2 ‘M’ ( M2 , M4 ), 2 ‘S’ ( S2 , S5 ) and 1 ‘Pa’ ( Pa5 ) mac ( Fig. 14E ). Labial papilla E with l.p. conical and not reaching the base of a.a. ; papilla H with 1 hypostomal appendix fringed distally ( Fig. 15A ). Maxillary palp with b.c. 0.74 smaller than t.a. ( Figs. 15B ). Basolateral and basomedian labial fields with chaetae M1 and L2 ciliate, m2 , e and l1 smooth, r reduced on a club-shaped basis, a1 often absent ( Fig. 15C ). Head ventrally with about 24 chaetae, 6 larger, acuminate and almost imperceptibly ciliate, 10 acuminate and finely ciliate, and 8 smaller and ciliate, none modified; postlabial formula with 4 ( G1–4 ), 1 ( X ) 4 ( H1–4 ), 3 ( J1–3 ) chaetae; proximal region of cephalic groove with 2 elongated acuminate chaetae, plus 1 and 5 chaetae on a transversal row respectively, near to b.c. ( Fig. 15D ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 13.
Trogolaphysa nigrolineata
sp. nov.
, habitus of a fixed specimen in ethanol (lateral view). Scale bars: 0.5mm.

FIGURE 15A–D.
Trogolaphysa nigrolineata
sp. nov.
: ventral head (right side); A , labial palp and p.c. , arrow indicates modified hypostomal appendix; B , maxillary palp and sublobal plate (right side); C , basomedian and basolateral labial fields and p.c. , arrow indicates r chaeta; D , complete postlabial chaetotaxy.

subSubSection.paragraph: Thorax dorsal chaetotaxy ( Fig. 16A ). Th II a and p series with 2 ( a5 and 1 of unclear homology) and 3 ( p3 complex) mac, respectively; m series with 4 mic ( m1–2 , m4 and 1 of unclear homology). Th III a , m and p series with 2 ( a1–2 ), 1 ( m6 ) and 4 ( p1–3 , p6 ) mic respectively, except for m6 as mac. Ratio Th II: III = 1.39–1.27: 1 (n= 4), holotype 1.39: 1.

Abdomen dorsal chaetotaxy ( Figs 16B–C ). Abd I a , m and p series with 2 ( a2 , a6 ), 4 ( m2–4 , m6 ) and 1 ( p6 ) mic, respectively. Abd II a , m and p series with 3 ( a2–3 , a6 ), 3 ( m3 , m5 , m7 ) and 2 ( p6–7 ) chaetae, respectively, m3 and m5 as mac, and 1 posterior scale-like chaeta present. Abd III a , m and p series with 3 ( a2–3 , a7 ), 6 ( m3 , am6 , pm6 , m7–8 ) and 3 ( p6–8 ) chaetae, respectively; a7 , m3 , am6 , pm6 , m7 , p6 and p7 as mac; m2 bothriotrichum with 2 accessory chaetae, and a5 and m5 bothriotricha with 9 accessory chaetae between them. Abd IV with 5 medial mac on series A–C ( A3–5 , B5–6 ) and 18 lateral mac on series T–Fe ( T7 , Te4 , D3 , E2–4 , F1–3 , Fe2–3 and 6 of unclear homologies); about 17 sens ( as and ps type I, and 15 medial type II), and 16 posterior mes present.Abd V a , m , pa , p and pp series with 3 ( a5–6a ), 4 ( m2–3 , m5–5a ), 1 ( p6ae ) and 6 ( p1 , p3–6e ) mac, respectively. Ratio Abd III: IV = 1: 5.24–9.05 (n= 4), holotype 1: 9.05.

Legs. Subcoxa I with one row of 2 chaetae and 2 posterior chaetae; subcoxa II with an anterior row of 14 chaetae, plus about 23 anterior and 1 posterior chaetae; posterior row of 9 chaetae, 9 posterior chaetae and 3 psp; subcoxa III with one row of 11–14 chaetae and about 40 anterior chaetae of different sizes ( Figs 17A–C ). Trochanteral organ with about 65 spine-like chaetae ( Fig. 17D ). Femur I–III with one outer longitudinal row of 2, 2, 1, 2 mac finely ciliate; proximal mac normal or apically acuminate, distal mac normal ( Figs 17E–F ); femur I–II internally with 6 mac apically acuminate and finely ciliate, 2 anterior, 2 inner and 2 posterior ones ( Fig. 17E ); femur III with an inner row of 5–8 (3 proximal present or absent) mac finely ciliate and apically rounded, and 1 proximal elongated chaetae apically acuminate; anterior side with 1 proximal elongated chaetae apically acuminate ( Fig. 17F ). Tibiotarsus I–III with 7 inner and 1 anterior mac finely ciliate ( Fig. 17G ); tibiotarsal smooth chaeta 0.84 smaller than the unguiculus, tenent hair 0.72 smaller than the unguis outer edge ( Fig. 17I ). Unguis I–III with 3–4 inner teeth, b.t. subequals, larger than the other teeth and on proximal ⅓ of the unguis, m.t. on distal ⅓, a.t. when present minute and on distal ⅙. Unguiculus with all lamellae smooth and acuminate ( ae , ai , pe , pi ), except pe with minute proximal tooth (very difficult to see) ( Figs 17H–I ); ratio unguis: unguiculus = 1: 0.66.

Furcula. Manubrium laterally with one row of 4–6 spine-like mac ciliated ( holotype with 5) ( Fig. 18B ); ventrally with 6 subapical and 7 elongated scales, internally with 3 ciliate chaetae ( Fig. 18C ); manubrial plate dorsally with 5 ciliated chaetae (2 inner larger than the internal ones) and 3 psp ( Fig. 18D ). Dens dorsally with an inner row of 29–40 spines subtly ciliated ( holotype with 40) and an outer row of 29–34 spine-like mac ciliated ( holotype with 29) ( Fig. 18E ). Mucro twice as long as its width and with 4 teeth, 3 ( ap , v1 , v2 ) in one dorsal row and 1 ( il ) on the inner side ( Fig. 18F ).

paragraph.emphasis: Description of the dorsal chaetotaxy in first instar.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head ( Fig. 19A ). Primary chaetotaxy with 3 ‘An’ ( An1–3 ), 5 ‘A’ ( A0–3 , A5 ), 4 ‘M’ ( M1–4 ), 4 ‘S’ ( S2–5 ), 3 ‘IO’ ( p , r , t ), 3 ‘Ps’ ( Ps2–3 , Ps5 ), 5 ‘Pa’ ( Pa1–3 , Pa5–6 ), 2 ‘Pm’ ( Pm1 , Pm3 ), 5 ‘Pp’ ( Pp1–3 , Pp5–6 ), and 4 ‘P3’ ( Pe2–3 , Pe5–6 ) chaetae; Pp4 chaeta absent.

Thorax ( Fig. 19B ). Th II a , m and p series with 7 ( a1–7 ), 6 ( m1–2 , m4–7 ) and 6 ( p1–6 ) primary chaetae, respectively; m3 chaeta typically absent. Th III a , m and p series with 7 ( a1–7 ), 5 ( m1 , m4–7 ) and 7 ( p1–7 ) primary chaetae, respectively, a1 as large scale and m2 and m3 chaetae typically absent.

Abdomen ( Fig. 19C–D ). Abd I a , m and p series with 5 ( a1–3 , a5–6 ), 5 ( m2–6 ) and 2 ( p6–7? ) primary chaetae, respectively, a1 as large scale. Abd II a , m and p series with 6 ( a1–3 , a5–7 ), 5 ( m2–3 , m5–7 ) and 2 ( p6–7 ) primary chaetae, respectively, a1 as large scale; laterally 1 scale and 1 mic of unclear homology. Abd III a , m and p series with 6 ( a1–2 , a5–8 ), 8 ( m2–5 , am6 , pm6 , m7–8 ) and 4 ( p3 , p6–8 ) primary chaetae, respectively, a1 as mac and a3 chaeta absent; laterally 2 mic of unclear homology. Abd IV A, B, C, T, D, E and F series with 5 ( A2–6 ), 5 ( B2–6 ), 4 ( C1–4 ), 7 ( T1–7 ), 3 ( D1–3 ), 4 ( E1–4 ) and 3 ( F1–3 ) primary chaetae, respectively; A2 and B2 as scales, A4 chaeta atypical, about 17 sens ( as and ps type I, and 15 medial type II) as in adult, D3p bothriotrichum and transversal row of posterior mes absent. Abd V a , m and p series with 4 ( a1 , a3 , a5–6 ), 3 ( m2–3 , m5 ) and 5 ( p1 , p3–6 ) chaetae respectively, acc.p4 sens absent.
Etymology. Refers to the color pattern with black lines present laterally (from Latin: nigrus ––black, and linea – –line) on Th II to Abd III of the new species ( Fig. 13 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 20. Records map of
Trogolaphysa nigrolineata
sp. nov.
, star represents the type locality and circles the additional localities.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Trogolaphysa nigrolineata
sp. nov.
resembles
T. nigrocephala
sp. nov.
and
T. pseudomaculata
sp. nov.
, therefore the comparison between these species is presented in the remarks of
T. nigrocephala
sp. nov.
and Table 2 .
